txt.en: 'Did you really put that old dog Oryat on his head?'
'And did Mithrandir's steed truly talk in verse?'
'Come, now. Have something to eat and drink. Take one of these wondrous poppets Túril found for us!'
'The truth is, we do not know. And there is little we boys and girls can do.'
'But Mithrandir is here, and Lord Denethor high above. And Prince Imrahil and good old Lord Forlong, and - and the Prince of the Halflings.'
'And my father has said that if fortune smiles upon us, all of Rohan will come pounding on horseback.'
'Friends, we have gathered these findings here in honour of [placeholder].'
'If they have not lost hope, then -'
'Yes, I think we should leave. Let us ALL go back to the Old Guest-house now, and decide what to do after that.'
The children's Gathering takes place in a back room of the Old Guest-house. Gifts, brought by all, are piled high on the table for all to enjoy.
Join the children at the table for the Finder's Gathering.
Take part in the Finder's Gathering with Bergil and the other children.
By dispatching  the goblins near Glatham and the strange woman, you have caught the attention of the goblin captain.

Gelwen stands with Bergil, Glatham, and the mysterious woman near where the goblins came in.\n\nYou have defeated the goblins who made a breach into this part of the cisterns and for the moment, it is safe. You should see what Gelwen has to say.
'...I can't wait 'til Gelwen and Glatham get here, for it should be much better with that jam.'
'Will you pass the dried meat, please?'
'Do be careful of those candles, Landath. After all the trouble you had getting them.'
'Yes, where are Gelwen and Glatham, I wonder?'
'I am sure they will be here any minute.'
'Mídion, why are you crying? What's wrong?'
'Tomorrow? Why should we think of that?'
'Now dry your eyes and have a sweet. There you are.'
Gelwen has stumbled into the room, troubled and out of breath. Talk to her to find out what has happened.
You have come with Gelwen and Bergil to the cisterns. See if Gelwen can retrace her steps and to find her brother Glatham.
'Those goblins forged a breach in the stone up there. More may come through at any moment.'

'Glatham and I... we were coming back through the cisterns when suddenly there were goblins everywhere. And I thought… I could swear that there was a strange woman there. I saw no more. I ran.

'I was certain Glatham was right behind me. But he wasn't. He is still in there with all those goblins.

'You must come at once, [placeholder]. Please!'
You have come with Gelwen and Bergil to the cisterns. Go with them and find Glatham.
'Now which way did I come? Yes, of course.'
You have found Glatham, surrounded by goblins! More goblins come in through a breach in the wall.
'I think Glatham is right in this, [placeholder]. Come, let us go - before any more goblins come in through that breach!'
Instance: The Banquet and the Breach
'Friends, we have gathered these findings here in honour of [placeholder].'
